column4: urgent....I downloaded a video from youtube and want to use it in ppt for my college presentation but libreoffice  is not saving the video even after adding it from insert menu. I think the problem is in the format. If so then which format should I use? Pitivi is installed. If not then how to do it?
are you sure the ppt file would include the video file itself and not just a link to it
you could try using ffmpeg or mencoder to convert the file to another format, but i have no idea what format would work better
are you sure that the video is supposed to be saved in the file.=
I want to do so. Is it possible?
i dont know, but i wouldn't be surprised if the normal behavior of the application is for the video to not be embedded but instead to be referenced by a relative path
urlin2u: need some WINE for this..
probably not but poppler-utils will have a pdftotext utility
no dear.. no help with poppler. It converts but not to odt :(
like i said i dont think you can get to odt in one shot
any other way.. indirect way will also work. websites are there whcih convert online but having something offline is of great help
i dont know of a way sorry
no prob.. atleast I get to know abotu poppler. :) Thank You
nice.. I thought of not puting him on CLI
you never know what will be easier for someone, CLI or GUI. usually i just see if one starts to go bad and then try the other
